section.title: Overview
section.description: The Display a Pick-List of Scripts action displays a pick-list dialog box, pop-up list, or toolbar of pre-written scripts. The pick-list can have a variety of options, depending on the style of pick-list you choose.

step.description: The scripts can be displayed in three different styles with variations. The toolbar style is illustrated below.
The pop-up list is illustrated here.
Select a style from the Pick List Style list. The options are:

case.description: "Toolbar" - Note : There is no Action Script that will close this "Toolbar". It must be close manually.

step.description: If you selected "Dialog box" in step 1, make a selection from the next drop down list box. The options include:

If you selected "Selected scripts, select scripts from the Available Scripts list. Click the button to add them to the Selected Scripts list. Click the button to remove them from the Selected Scripts list.
For each entry in the Selected Scripts list, enter a description in the Description field.
For each entry in the Selected Scripts list, optionally select an image from the Image Name list. Optionally, click to display the Insert Image dialog box.
Optionally, structure your choices to appear in the tabbed (or sub-menu) format. To do this click Define Tab Pages to create the tabs or sub-menus.
If you are using tabs (or sub-menus), select each item in the Scripts list and select the tab (or sub-menu) that it will appear on from the Is on tab page list.
If you selected "Dialog box" or "Toolbar" in step 1, enter its title in the Title field.
If you selected "Dialog box" in step 1, enter the number of rows to display in the Rows field.
If you selected "Dialog box" in step 1, optionally enter the width of the list box in characters. The default value "0" will automatically size the list to its largest entry.
Optionally modify the comment that describes the action.
